UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA
UNIVERSITY, ALABAMA
EXTENSION DIVISION p, o. BOX 2787
January 16, 1952
Mr* Oraydon Ausreua, Director
Radio Broadcasting Services
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Oraydon*
For the last several years the National University Extension Associa¬
tion has had a national Committee on Implications of Atomic Energy.
This Committee has enjcyed a very close working relationship with the
Atomic Energy Commission and a large part of the educational interests
of the Atomic Energy Commission have consequently had expression through
the NUEA.
The most spectacular project which has been developed up to date has
been the mobile Atomic Energy Exhibit which was constructed at a cost
of about 1100,000. This Exhibit will be shown this year in some seven
or eight states and will be seen by about 2,000,000 people. It is
already scheduled for approximately three years.
It happens that I m Chairman of this Committee during the current
year and we have been considering the possibilities for expanding our
work into new areas. Up to the present time there has been no organ¬
ised large-scale activity for interpreting the implications of atomic
energy through the medium of radio. I am wondering if the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters would be interested in exploring
thsse possibilities with us.
I should appreciate your calling this matter to the attention of the
proper officials of the NAEB and letting m have their reactions as
soon as convenient. If this group should prove to be interested in
looking over these possibilities, please request the president of the
NAE3 to appoint one or more appropriate people to meet with our NUEA
Committee at a suitable time*
Very sincerely youra,
J. R. Morton, Director
Continuation Education
